subject: Re: Testing server components with a Mock context
msgSnippet: ... tomcat and ... Hi Lasse, yes, also simple-jndi doesn t require changes in the code since. Ste
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Stefano,
>
> On 10/14/07, stefano_nichele <stefano.nichele@...> wrote:
> > I'm doing test cases for some server components that run in
tomcat and
> > that perform datasource lookup. [...] What do you think about
> > simple-jndi vs MockEJB ? (note that I'm not interesting in ejb)
>
> Personally, I like the fact that using MockEJB's MockContextFactory
> class for testing does not imply anything about the implementation of
> the production code. I'm not sure if this is the case with
> simple-jndi?
>
> Lasse
>

Hi Lasse,
yes, also simple-jndi doesn't require changes in the code since.

Ste
